intro: Malva mathewsii, commonly known as Mathews' mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along stream banks. Malva mathewsii is adapted to drought conditions and is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
